repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Hi, I'm adding a few things that should improve compatibility with GraalPy. I was testing with pre-release build of upcoming GraalPy 25.0 (implements Python 3.12).
- Use datetime macros instead of struct access
- Set `CYTHON_AVOID_THREAD_UNSAFE_BORROWED_REFS` to `0`. This macro seems to lead to code paths that assume Python 3.13.
- Use new GraalPy public functions that are prefixed with `GraalPy`. We had to do a rename to prevent future name collisions with CPython (i.e. imagine if they add `PySlice_Start` with different refcounting semantics) and to make it clearer which APIs are GraalPy-specific.
- Add partial support for `array`. Currently only implements the access to `data` and the resize functions that are used by scikit-learn

I'm still working on getting the tests running again, I'll make another PR for that.

comment_data.body:
... then my change to the name for `__data_union` would involve changing

```
    ctypedef union __data_union "__Pyx_data_union":
```

to keep the same name in Cython in case anyone's relying on it.

But I can't add it as a suggestion because it's too far up.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -99,7 +99,10 @@ cdef extern from *:  # Hard-coded utility code hack.
         cdef:
             Py_ssize_t ob_size
             arraydescr* ob_descr    # struct arraydescr *ob_descr;
-            __data_union data
+

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_GRAAL
    return GraalPyArray_Resize((PyObject*)self, n);
#else
```

Similarly here moving the general case to the else

commit.message: Use acccessor macros for timedelta members
Avoid deprecated Py_OptimizeFlag on GraalPy as well
Avoid triggering 3.13 codepaths on GraalPy on 3.12
Use GraalPy prefixed symbols for GraalPy public APIs
Implement few array operations on GraalPy

Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: da-woods <dw-git@d-woods.co.uk>

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description: First feature release after the cleanup releases 3.0 and 3.1.

title: Improve GraalPy support
